New Records: Adolis Garcia set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15.
García slugged his sixth home run this postseason to pass Houston slugger Yordan Alvarez (six) for the most home runs in the playoffs this year.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager got things started for the Rangers with a long home run in the first inning.
Adolis García homered twice and drove in five runs as the Rangers secured their spot in the World Series.

Texas led the AL West for most of the year, only to squander the division crown to Houston with a loss at Seattle on the final day of the regular season that sent the streaky Rangers on the road to begin the playoffs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers had to win on the road to secure their spot in the World Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, who came out of retirement this season to manage the Rangers, became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
Meanwhile, the defending World Series champion Astros were finally dethroned.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas has gone 8-0 away from home in these playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Others: Jordan Montgomery, normally a starter, came out of the bullpen on two days’ rest and pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Max Scherzer, acquired from the Mets in July, allowed four hits and two runs with two walks in 2 2/3 innings.
